text: Mercedes Schlapp (n√©e Viana) (born December 15, 1972)https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:KLJG-KV7 is an American lobbyist and columnist. She was born in Miami, Florida. Schlapp is a Republican. From September 2017 to July 2019, she was the second White House Director of Strategic Communications during the Donald Trump presidency, replacing Hope Hicks. Before being a member of the Trump administration, Schlapp was a critic of Trump. ==References== Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:American lobbyists Category:American columnists Category:Republicans (United States) Category:Writers from Miami
title: Mercedes Schlapp
